content:
If folks have not already done so, it might be worthwhile to sign up for the Pantheon Heroes program: https://community.pantheon.io/

Pantheon Community — Deploy Heroically
Contributing to the open web by using our superpowers for good.

Hi, Mike McCaffrey. Welcome to the Backdrop CMS community on Zulip. I'm your friendly neighborhood Dragonbot. Try '@Dragonbot help' for a list of things I can help you with. There are lots of friendly humans that hang around here, so please feel free to ask questions.

Here is a short (3 min) video to help you navigate Zulip. https://youtu.be/DN8YL2MrsSU
It seems like a great way to complain to them directly through official channels, rather than just calling them out on twitter or backchanneling with the founders.
Alternatively, since I just signed up, let me know if there is any complaining I can do to them on our community's behalf.
@Mike McCaffrey nice! I can't say I have much to complain about. Greg Anderson has been pretty helpful. But wouldn't mind to have help from them in getting drush working with Backdrop on Pantheon
This has always been our complaint as a community:
...if you can get them to list us there, then it'd be awesome :sweat_smile:
And hopefully not introduced with "Maintaining Backdrop sites can be a pain..." - WTF, what's so much "pain" with Drupal 7? What a weird promotion approach...
I only noticed that now that you've mentioned it @indigoxela ...I feel the same :disappointed:
